definitions.definition: To assume control of something, especially by force; to usurp.
To adopt a further responsibility or duty.
definitions.example: He will take over the job permanently when the accountant retires.
If you will take over driving, I'd like to get some sleep.

definitions.definition: To buy out the ownership of a business.
definitions.example: Acme Motors is to take Jetcar Industries over this week, if all goes as planned.

definitions.definition: To annex a territory by conquest or invasion.
definitions.example: Ancient Rome took over lands throughout the known world.

definitions.definition: To become more successful (than someone or something else).
definitions.example: Buzz Lightyear has taken over Woody as the most popular children's toy.
